result.execSummary:
All charges against Amara K.I Johnson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amara K.I Johnson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amara K.I Johnson

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final - Criminal Bond Deposits (C Soik-Johnson)

8:35 a.m.  Defendant, Amara K.I. Johnson, does not appear.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.
This is set for an extradition hearing.
ADA Cassidy makes statements with regards to the extradition hearing.
Court questions ADA Cassidy if she is requesting an extension of 30 days.
ADA Cassidy is not requesting an extension and explains why on the record.
Court questions ADA Cassidy is she is motioning the court to dismiss this case.
This was a probationary extradition and court makes a statement on the record.
ADA Cassidy states that she is and would ask that this case be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:
Based on the State's Motion to Dismiss it is GRANTED.
Created this event to dismiss this case
Status conference on March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Reside at residence as stated on the record, during pendency of this action.

01:56 PM Defendant Amara K.I Johnson in court with Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner. Defendant Amara K.I Johnson in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Atty Bergner and his client has received a copy of the complaint, regarding extradition.
Court questions Atty Bergner.
Atty Bergner replies.

Court will enter a not guilty on Defendant's behalf.

Status conference will be set.

State has 60 days to produce warrant.
30 days is a mile marker.

Atty Bergner is making a special appearance.
Defendant's parents will be retaining private counsel.

State addresses bond, cash bond with condition as stated.
Atty Bergner addresses the Court.

Discussions continue.
Defendant is a resident of Stevens Point, was in Indiana temporarily.
Defendant's mother addresses the Court.
Court questions Defendant's mother.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders cash bond.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
